Uses of Class
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport.Boundary

Packages that use Boundary
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item history service provides clients with the ability to look at the changes that items have undergone as a result of edit and merge operations. The service also enables clients to examine the differences between two versions of an item.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in. 
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport Contains classes for the service that reports on changes to items in the Analysis Repository. 
 

Uses of Boundary in com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice
 

Methods in com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice with parameters of type Boundary
 ItemHistory IItemHistoryService.retrieveItemHistory(ItemIdentifier itemIdentifier, Boundary start, Boundary end, List<VersionChangeType> changeTypes, int maxVersionCount, OverflowPolicy overflowPolicy)
          Retrieves an ItemHistory that contains summary information about the changes that have taken place to the specified Item between two specified points.
 

Uses of Boundary in com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport
 

Subclasses of Boundary in com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport
 class AbsoluteBoundary
          A Boundary that specifies one end of a range of Item versions to be the very first or very last of all versions.
 class TimestampBoundary
          A Boundary that uses a timestamp to specify one end of a range of Item versions.
 class VersionBoundary
          A Boundary that uses a particular version number to specify one end of a range of Item versions.
